brewery.brewery_description:
Already in 1417, there is mention of a “Preustatt in the Hagkagasse” in the heart of Munich (Preustatt means ‘brewery’ in Old German). Today the tradition is continued in the “Alten Hackerhaus” in the Sendlinger Straße, where our beer is served and highly appreciated, not just by the residents of Munich but also by guests from around the world.

The name Hacker-Pschorr dates back to the marriage of Teresia Hacker and Joseph Pschorr. Under the couple’s leadership, Hacker-Pschorr advanced to become Munich’s leading major brewery in the 18th century.
Doing business in a sustainable and environmental manner combined with courage and innovation, that is “the heaven of the Bavarians,” a Hacker-Pschorr tradition since 1417.

venue.venue_name: Yard House Las Colinas - Toyota Music Factory
Yard House San Jose - Santana Row

I am drinking
I am drinking yellow flowers
in underground sunlight
and you can see that I am a sensitive man

beer.beer_description:
“Munich Gold” closely resembles our Münchner Hell in terms of taste and mainly owes its popularity to a slightly higher original gravity and the malty note. The result is a full-bodied yet mild taste which delivers an increasingly bitter note before culminating into an aromatic finish. A real treat for true beer connoisseurs! 
 
 The types of barley grown in the Swabian Jura and in the Upper Palatinate Region of Bavaria are excellently suited for the production of this timeless classic.
 
 Hacker-Pschorr has been brewing beer in the traditional Bavarian manner since 1417. The high-quality beers the brewery produces are all brewed in accordance with the Bavarian Purity Law and contain only water, malt and hops.

venue.venue_name: Yard House Las Colinas - Toyota Music Factory

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 130 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 27!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 240 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 49!

beer.beer_description: Our unfiltered Hacker-Pschorr Weissbier is naturally cloudy, full-flavoured and uniquely refreshing. The history of Munich's Hacker-Pschorr goes all the way back to 1417 and even plays a leading role in the foundation of Oktoberfest, when Prince Ludwig I of Bavaria asked them to brew a special beer for his Wedding in 1810.

items.badge_description: Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least 175 distinct venues!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 370 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 75!
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 205 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 42!
It may not be cloudy outside, but your brew definitely is! That’s at least 10 different hefeweizens. Try 5 more to unlock Level 3.

Das sind mindestens 15 deutsche Biere! David Hasselhoff would be proud of you. Prost!

That's 15 different German Beers! Try 5 more for Level 4.

beer.beer_description: The traditional Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest Märzen. Note that this is not the Festbier served at the Wies'n.

Our unfiltered Hacker-Pschorr Weissbier is naturally cloudy, full-flavoured and uniquely refreshing. The history of Munich's Hacker-Pschorr goes all the way back to 1417 and even plays a leading role in the foundation of Oktoberfest, when Prince Ludwig I of Bavaria asked them to brew a special beer for his Wedding in 1810.

Honiggolden schimmert das Naturtrübe Kellerbier verführerisch im Licht. Ein Bier mit unverwechselbarem Charakter: urig, kernig, süffig und dennoch erfrischend mild und leicht. Ein echter Bayer eben.

Cremig-moussierend – typisch für unfiltrierte Biere – perlt es genussvoll am Gaumen. Aromen von Karamell, Honig und Pflaume kommen ins Spiel und betonen das malzig-würzige Geschmackserlebnis. Dazu gesellen sich unverkennbar Nuancen von Apfel und Grapefruit, die dem Bier seine fruchtige Frische verleihen.

Nach vier Wochen Reifezeit wird es unfiltriert abgefüllt und enthält so noch alle in der Hefe vorkommenden Vitamine und Spurenelemente.

Das sind mindestens 15 deutsche Biere! David Hasselhoff would be proud of you. Prost!

That's 15 different German Beers! Try 5 more for Level 4.

items.checkin_comment: Got this from my parents who went to Germany years ago and it’s been in the back of my fridge since. More of a stout person (sweet tooth). This is okay, not the worst I’ve had. Has a good flavor profile with some complexity.

beer.beer_description:
The silky shine and intense golden yellow hue of our Weisse, topped off with a compact and creamy head of froth, is a truly magnificent sight.

The yeast evolves gently to deliver a magnificently refreshing fruity and citrus note accompanied by a fine sparkling hint of acidity. The light sweetness of bananas and honey melt on the tongue and mingle with subtle and slightly more bitter notes of nutmeg.

Only the best ingredients are used in our unfiltered Weissbier – brewer’s wheat grown in the Champagne Region and selected certified hops from the Hallertau. Thanks to a special brewing process this beer fulfils its promise and provides an excellent taste.

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 25 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 6!

If your mash uses more than 50% wheat, you’ve got yourself a wheat beer. This diverse family includes goses, hefeweizens, American wheat ales, and more! That's 5 different beers in the "Wheat" category! Try 5 more for Level 2!

Honiggolden schimmert das Naturtrübe Kellerbier verführerisch im Licht. Ein Bier mit unverwechselbarem Charakter: urig, kernig, süffig und dennoch erfrischend mild und leicht. Ein echter Bayer eben.

Cremig-moussierend – typisch für unfiltrierte Biere – perlt es genussvoll am Gaumen. Aromen von Karamell, Honig und Pflaume kommen ins Spiel und betonen das malzig-würzige Geschmackserlebnis. Dazu gesellen sich unverkennbar Nuancen von Apfel und Grapefruit, die dem Bier seine fruchtige Frische verleihen.

Nach vier Wochen Reifezeit wird es unfiltriert abgefüllt und enthält so noch alle in der Hefe vorkommenden Vitamine und Spurenelemente.

beer.beer_description: The traditional Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest Märzen. Note that this is not the Festbier served at the Wies'n.

Our unfiltered Hacker-Pschorr Weissbier is naturally cloudy, full-flavoured and uniquely refreshing. The history of Munich's Hacker-Pschorr goes all the way back to 1417 and even plays a leading role in the foundation of Oktoberfest, when Prince Ludwig I of Bavaria asked them to brew a special beer for his Wedding in 1810.

“Munich Gold” closely resembles our Münchner Hell in terms of taste and mainly owes its popularity to a slightly higher original gravity and the malty note. The result is a full-bodied yet mild taste which delivers an increasingly bitter note before culminating into an aromatic finish. A real treat for true beer connoisseurs! 
 
 The types of barley grown in the Swabian Jura and in the Upper Palatinate Region of Bavaria are excellently suited for the production of this timeless classic.
 
 Hacker-Pschorr has been brewing beer in the traditional Bavarian manner since 1417. The high-quality beers the brewery produces are all brewed in accordance with the Bavarian Purity Law and contain only water, malt and hops.

Seit Jahrhunderten wird in München eine Bierspezialität gebraut, die den Charakter der bayrischen Hauptstadt in Hopfen und Malz übersetzt: das Münchner Hell. Weich und malzig, edel gehopft und himmlisch wie die Frauenkirche. Mehr München hat nicht in die Flasche gepasst.

Honiggolden schimmert das Naturtrübe Kellerbier verführerisch im Licht. Ein Bier mit unverwechselbarem Charakter: urig, kernig, süffig und dennoch erfrischend mild und leicht. Ein echter Bayer eben.

Cremig-moussierend – typisch für unfiltrierte Biere – perlt es genussvoll am Gaumen. Aromen von Karamell, Honig und Pflaume kommen ins Spiel und betonen das malzig-würzige Geschmackserlebnis. Dazu gesellen sich unverkennbar Nuancen von Apfel und Grapefruit, die dem Bier seine fruchtige Frische verleihen.

Nach vier Wochen Reifezeit wird es unfiltriert abgefüllt und enthält so noch alle in der Hefe vorkommenden Vitamine und Spurenelemente.

It is served at the Oktoberfest, under the “Heaven of Bavaria”. Now also in bottles since 2024.

Our hearty Wiesn specialty. Bright like light amber - distinctive and tasty. Our Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest beer - a beer with a distinctive, independent character and yet pleasantly mild and drinkable.

We have revived the old recipe and with it a quaffable, honey-colored piece of Oktoberfest history. Brewed according to the Bavarian Purity Law of 1516.

The silky shine and intense golden yellow hue of our Weisse, topped off with a compact and creamy head of froth, is a truly magnificent sight.

The yeast evolves gently to deliver a magnificently refreshing fruity and citrus note accompanied by a fine sparkling hint of acidity. The light sweetness of bananas and honey melt on the tongue and mingle with subtle and slightly more bitter notes of nutmeg.

Only the best ingredients are used in our unfiltered Weissbier – brewer’s wheat grown in the Champagne Region and selected certified hops from the Hallertau. Thanks to a special brewing process this beer fulfils its promise and provides an excellent taste.
This Maibock pours a rustic yellow with aromas of semi sweet malts, grainy and underlying noble hops.
Winterfestbier

Hacker-Pschorr, Munich’s Brewery since 1417, has released a Limited Edition Series which is a collection of hand-crafted specialty beers produced in small single-brew batches and available in the US only while supply last. 

Among the earliest Dopplebocks, Animator draws you in with its deep mahogany hue and creamy foam crown Your experience culminates on the palate with notes of chocolate, roast, brown sugar, licorice, apricot, and exotic fruit.

Unser Naturtrübes Radler Alkoholfrei besticht durch seine feine Trübung und seinen fruchtigen Charakter. Intensive Zitrusnoten verbinden sich mit dezenten Malzaromen. Im Geschmack erfrischende, leicht herbe Noten von Limette, die mit der angenehmen Süße unserer ausgewählten Malzsorten harmonieren. Mit seinem fruchtig-spritzigen Charakter ist es eine ideale Abwechslung zu herkömmlichen Säften oder Limonaden.
Zutaten

50% Hellbier alkoholfrei (Wasser, Gerstenmalz, Gärungskohlensäure, Hefe, Hopfen), 50% Zitronenlimonade (Wasser, Zucker, Zitronensaft* (3,3%), Orangensaft*, Limettensaft*, Gärungskohlensäure, natürliches Zitronenaroma mit anderen natürlichen Aromen, Stabilisator Johannisbrotkernmehl)
*aus Fruchtsaftkonzentraten
